original: @71a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @71a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: k'a ya pa ri ka bh'a ba na kra ma /
analyzed: k'a ya pa ri ka bh'a ba na kra ma /
translated: KƒÅyaparƒ´k·π£ƒÅbhƒÅvanƒÅkrama

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: lus yongs su dpyad pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: lus yongs su dpyad pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa /
translated: The Stages of Meditation on the Thorough Examination of the Body

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha.

original: 'di la slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
translated: Here, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: 'jig rten rnam par rtog las byung //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnam par rtog las byung //
translated: The world arises from conceptuality.

original: rnam par rtog pa sems las byung //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa sems las byung //
translated: Conceptualization arises from the mind.

original: sems kyang lus las byung bas na //
analyzed: sems kyang lus las byung bas na //
translated: The mind also arises from the body.

original: de'i phyir lus la dpyad par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la dpyad par bya // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, examine the body.

original: des lus la brtag pa ni snying po gsum dang / lus zungs bdun dang / spu'i tshogs brgyad dang / ba spu'i khung bu bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang / so sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / sen mo nyi shu dang / pags pa'i rim pa bdun dang /
analyzed: des lus la brtag pa ni snying po gsum dang / lus zungs bdun dang / spu'i tshogs brgyad dang / ba spu'i khung bu bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang / so sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / sen mo nyi shu dang / pags pa'i rim pa bdun dang /
translated: Thus, the examination of the body is as follows: the three essential constituents, the seven constituents of the body, the eight collections of hair, the eighty million pores, the thirty-two teeth, the twenty nails, and the seven layers of skin.

original: bu ga dgu dang / 'bur bcu gcig dang / nang gi dngos po nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / sha spar tshad lnga brgya dang / rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang / rgyus pa bdun brgya dang / chu ba bcu drug dang / srin bu'i rigs bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang /
analyzed: bu ga dgu dang / 'bur bcu gcig dang / nang gi dngos po nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / sha spar tshad lnga brgya dang / rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang / rgyus pa bdun brgya dang / chu ba bcu drug dang / srin bu'i rigs bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang /
translated: the nine orifices, the eleven protuberances, the twenty-one internal things, the five hundred pieces of flesh, the seventy-two thousand channels, the seven hundred ligaments, the sixteen large and small intestines, and the eighty million types of worms.

original: nad gzhi rnam pa bzhi dang / mi gtsang ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gang nam mkha'i khams dang / rus pa sum brgya drug cu dang / tshigs sum brgya dang / gnad brgya rtsa bdun chas pa dang /
analyzed: nad gzhi rnam pa bzhi dang / mi gtsang ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gang nam mkha'i khams dang / rus pa sum brgya drug cu dang / tshigs sum brgya dang / gnad brgya rtsa bdun chas pa dang /
translated: The four types of diseases, the twenty-two impurities, the four great elements, the space element, the three hundred and sixty bones, the three hundred joints, and the one hundred and seven vital points.

original: yang phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / skye mched rnams kyang 'di'i char chos ji lta bar brtag cing dpyad do //
analyzed: yang phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / skye mched rnams kyang 'di'i char chos ji lta bar brtag cing dpyad do //
translated: Moreover, the five aggregates, the eighteen elements, dependent origination, and the sense bases should be examined and analyzed as they are in the teachings.

original: de nas yang ji ltar slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas //
analyzed: de nas yang ji ltar slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas //
translated: Then, as stated by the master DignƒÅga,

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes rdo rje yis //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes rdo rje yis //
translated: With the vajra of nonconceptual wisdom,

original: lus kyi 'khrul 'khor thams cad gzhig par bya //
analyzed: lus kyi 'khrul 'khor thams cad gzhig par bya //
translated: destroy all the body's mechanisms.üîΩIn this way, you should analyze the body's components, from the joints, barley, peas, mustard seeds, sheep, goats, deer, sunbeams, iron particles, water particles, and subtle particles, each of which is seven times larger than the one below it.

original: zhes bshad pa'i rim pas sor tshigs dang / nas dang / shig dang / sro ma dang / glang dang / lug dang / ri @71b bong dang / nyi zer dang / lcags dang / chu'i rdul dang / rdul phra mo dang / phra rab dag gong nas 'og tu bdun du bskyungs pas dpyad nas tha mar rdul phra rab de ni ji ltar 'phags pas yang dag par dpyod pa'i tshul du nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul ba'i bzod pa'i mdo las ji skad du gsungs pa de bzhin du bsgom ste
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i rim pas sor tshigs dang / nas dang / shig dang / sro ma dang / glang dang / lug dang / ri @71b bong dang / nyi zer dang / lcags dang / chu'i rdul dang / rdul phra mo dang / phra rab dag gong nas 'og tu bdun du bskyungs pas dpyad nas tha mar rdul phra rab de ni ji ltar 'phags pas yang dag par dpyod pa'i tshul du nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul ba'i bzod pa'i mdo las ji skad du gsungs pa de bzhin du bsgom ste
translated: Finally, you should meditate on the subtle particles in the same way that the noble ones analyze them, as described in the Sutra of the Patient Acceptance that is Endowed with the Lenghtened Metamorphosis.

original: / shin tu phra ba'i rdul gcig po de la ji ltar lhag mthong phra mos brtag ce na /
analyzed: / shin tu phra ba'i rdul gcig po de la ji ltar lhag mthong phra mos brtag ce na /
translated: How should you investigate that single subtle particle with subtle insight?

original: rdul phra mo gcig po de la ji ltar mtshan nyid med pa nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur par rab tu shes /
analyzed: rdul phra mo gcig po de la ji ltar mtshan nyid med pa nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur par rab tu shes /
translated: You should fully understand that that single subtle particle is devoid of characteristics and is free from all afflictions.

original: bdag med pa dang rnam par bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang rnam par bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: They know that it is free from self and separation.

original: dngos po med pa dang don dam pa'i tshig gi lam dang bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang don dam pa'i tshig gi lam dang bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: They know that it is free from the path of words that are things and the ultimate.

original: dmigs pa med pa dang sgra dbyangs thams cad dang bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa dang sgra dbyangs thams cad dang bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: They know that it is free from all sounds and melodies that are not objects.

original: bdag med pa dang bral ba dang / bdud kyi mtshan nyid du rab tu shes /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang bral ba dang / bdud kyi mtshan nyid du rab tu shes /
translated: They know that it is free from self and is the characteristic of MƒÅra.

original: yi ge med par rgyu rkyen dang bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: yi ge med par rgyu rkyen dang bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: They know that it is free from syllables and causes and conditions.

original: dngos po med pa dang rgyu rkyen dang bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang rgyu rkyen dang bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: They know that it is free from things and causes and conditions.

original: mtshan ma med pa las rdul shin tu bral bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa las rdul shin tu bral bar rab tu shes te /
translated: They know that it is free from signs and dust.

original: ji ltar 'du byed thams cad rab tu zhi ba la rnam pa brgyad po de dag gis shin tu phra mo zhig tu brtag go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'du byed thams cad rab tu zhi ba la rnam pa brgyad po de dag gis shin tu phra mo zhig tu brtag go //
translated: In this way, they should investigate the subtle nature of all formations through these eight aspects in order to pacify them.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa nas nang gi lus thams cad kyi bar du gcig la yang so sor rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis rdul phra mo zhig tu brtag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa nas nang gi lus thams cad kyi bar du gcig la yang so sor rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis rdul phra mo zhig tu brtag go //
translated: Likewise, the second, and likewise, the third, and so on, until all the internal body is examined in each of these eight aspects as a subtle particle.

original: nang gi lus ji lta ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi lus sa'i khams kyang rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis so sor rdul shin tu phra bar brtag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: nang gi lus ji lta ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi lus sa'i khams kyang rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis so sor rdul shin tu phra bar brtag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par ston te /
translated: Just as with the internal body, the external body, the earth element, and so on, are to be examined in each of these eight aspects as a subtle particle.

original: de ltar lus la rnam par dpyad na nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bskom mo //
analyzed: de ltar lus la rnam par dpyad na nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bskom mo //
translated: Thus, when the body is analyzed, it is like space.

original: de nas ngag kyang byung ma thag tu zhig cing nam mkhar thim par brag ca dang 'dra bar yul na mi gnas shing /
analyzed: de nas ngag kyang byung ma thag tu zhig cing nam mkhar thim par brag ca dang 'dra bar yul na mi gnas shing /
translated: Then, the voice, as soon as it arises, is destroyed and dissolves into space, like an echo, not abiding in an object.

original: sems kyang kha dog dang dbyibs dang skye gnas dang / snod dang sems can du mi dmigs par gyur gyi bar du blta ste /
analyzed: sems kyang kha dog dang dbyibs dang skye gnas dang / snod dang sems can du mi dmigs par gyur gyi bar du blta ste /
translated: The mind is also to be examined until it is seen that it is not observed to have color, shape, birthplace, vessel, or sentient being.

original: de'i tshe thams cad nam mkha'i ngo bor gnas so ;
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad nam mkha'i ngo bor gnas so ;
translated: At that time, everything abides as the essence of space.

original: /'di nyid la goms pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa rtog pa nas ji srid rga shi'i bar du ji lta bar shes pas bde bar gnas so //
analyzed: /'di nyid la goms pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa rtog pa nas ji srid rga shi'i bar du ji lta bar shes pas bde bar gnas so //
translated: By cultivating this very [insight], one abides in bliss through the knowledge of how [the process of dependent origination] is, from the incorrect mental activity and the false imagination up to aging and death.

original: de nas ni ji ltar dga' ba'i gzugs kyi lus kyis bdag dang gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba sgyu ma ltar spyad do //
analyzed: de nas ni ji ltar dga' ba'i gzugs kyi lus kyis bdag dang gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba sgyu ma ltar spyad do //
translated: Then, with a body of form as one wishes, one practices the benefit and happiness of oneself and others, like an illusion.

original: @72a * // lus yongs su dpyad pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa slob dpon nag bo zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: @72a * // lus yongs su dpyad pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pa slob dpon nag bo zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The stages of meditation on the examination of the body composed by the master K·πõ·π£·πáapa·πá·∏çita are complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po de nyid dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab kyis bsgyur cing zhus pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po de nyid dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab kyis bsgyur cing zhus pa'o//
translated: It was translated and revised by the Indian preceptor himself and the monk-translator Ch√∂kyi Sherab.
